meanings.sent1: After making a mistake, the government had to retax the citizens.
meanings.sent2: The city council decided to retax the properties in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The accountant accidentally hit the retax button twice, causing chaos.
meanings.sent4: The idea to retax the wealthy was like hitting a hornet's nest.
meanings.sent5: The decision to retax sparked heated debates among the politicians.

meanings.definition: To impose a new tax on.
meanings.sent1: The government plans to retax luxury items to increase revenue.
meanings.sent2: They will retax imported goods to protect local industries.
meanings.sent3: The proposal to retax sugary drinks received mixed reactions.
meanings.sent4: The decision to retax online purchases was met with resistance.
meanings.sent5: The plan to retax fuel sparked concerns among drivers.

meanings.sent1: The authorities had to retax the businesses due to an error in calculations.
meanings.sent2: It is necessary to retax the properties in accordance with the new law.
meanings.sent3: The decision to retax the citizens caused quite a stir in the town.
meanings.sent4: The government's move to retax certain industries was unexpected.
meanings.sent5: The decision to retax created confusion among the taxpayers.
